enemies.name: E-Type Glyphs
enemies.summary: Baseline constructs minted from exponential residue; the count of trailing zeros reveals the exponent of their vitality.
traits: Display as (E^{k}) with a crimson exponent tied to (10^{k}) maximum health; even reduced health never hides the power tier.
March in geometric platoons whose health resolves to (H(k) = H_0 	imes 10^{k}) for rank k within the current set.
Reward Σ motes on defeat using the same multiplier, making them ideal calibration targets for lattice tuning.
enemies.counter: Layer multiplicative auras and β/γ towers so burst and splash damage keep pace with the exponential swell before specialist glyphs appear.
enemies.lore: Archivists open every defense proof against E glyphs; when their sigils begin to blur, heavier conjectures are on approach.

enemies.name: Divisors
enemies.summary: Factor-savvy husks that invert reckless power. They judge every incoming strike by its divisor weight and respond in kind.
traits: Appear as (÷^{k})—their glowing red exponent advertises the precise ten-power plateaus they occupy.
Damage from one source collapses to (\Delta H = 1 / 	ext{DPS}_{\text{source}}), so slower cannons barely scratch the shell.
Stacked beams add their DPS before inversion, rewarding multi-lane coverage and allied summons.
enemies.counter: Deploy swarm emitters, Ω slows, and status lattices to multiply projectile count while letting lingering damage-over-time finish the proof.
enemies.lore: Their chants enumerate divisors as they advance; silence one and the entire column hesitates for a breath.

enemies.name: Prime Counters
enemies.summary: Inquisitors that audit impact counts against the prime sequence. They do not care about damage—only how often they are struck.
traits: Broadcast as (ℙ^{k}), letting you spot at a glance which prime threshold—scaled by (10^{k}) health—they are testing.
Maintain an internal counter η that increases with each hit until (η = p_n), the nth prime for their current wave.
Overflow resets η to the next prime threshold, so wasted barrages delay a collapse.
enemies.counter: Favor rapid-fire towers, β resonance buffs, or allied reversals that deal consistent tap damage to meet each prime without overshooting.
enemies.lore: Their whispers recite primes in ascending order; the moment you match their cadence, the husk fractures.

enemies.name: Reversal Sentinels
enemies.summary: Vanguard constructs tuned to flip allegiance. Defeat one and it races backward to join your formation with inverted statistics.
traits: Carry the mark (↺^{k})—the exponent glows brighter after conversion to highlight the retained ten-power health tier.
Upon collapse they sprint to the start of the path; if unblocked they respawn as allies with (H_{ally} = lfloor 0.5 H_{foe} floor).
Allied reversals inherit your active tower modifiers and pulse Σ motes while retracing enemy ground.
enemies.counter: Catch them near choke points so the conversion occurs within supportive auras, otherwise their retreat might breach the core first.
enemies.lore: Legend says each sentinel carries a mirrored proof; persuade it to turn the page and the margin glows with your sigil.

enemies.name: Quantum Tunnelers
enemies.summary: Phase-shifted glyphs that refuse to follow etched rails, boring a straight tunnel toward the core regardless of your lattice work.
traits: Advance along the direct vector from spawn gate to core nexus, bypassing every bend, choke point, and slow field etched onto the lane.
Treat their displacement as (\vec{r}(t) = \vec{r}_0 + \vec{v} t); only raw damage intersecting that ray can arrest their collapse.
enemies.counter: Predict the tunnel vector and anchor lattices near the core or directly on that line—positioning, not crowd control, halts their breach.
enemies.lore: Archivists describe them as qubits gone feral: collapse their waveform before it resolves inside the heart of your proof.

enemies.name: Aleph Swarm
enemies.summary: Countable-infinity splinters that multiply the longer they survive, overwhelming defenses with relentless recursion.
traits: Render as (ℵ_0^{k})—their red exponent pulses with each duplication to telegraph the growing (10^{k}) health pool.
Spawn additional copies at intervals determined by (\lambda(t) = \lambda_0 + \lfloor t / T floor), so survival time fuels the swarm.
enemies.counter: Keep continuous-area effects engaged to prune duplicates before their exponent climbs beyond manageable tiers.
enemies.lore: Pearlescent dust settles wherever they fall, as though infinity itself were being counted grain by grain.

enemies.name: Partial Wraith
enemies.summary: Spectral siphons that leech tower stats until slowed, modelling derivatives that refuse to settle.
traits: Stride in (∂^{k}) forms—the exponent glows fiercely while the wraith hoards stolen power tied to its (10^{k}) reserve.
Absorb a fraction of nearby tower modifiers as (\Delta S = \alpha \cdot S_{tower}); rooting them freezes the derivative at zero and returns the loss.
enemies.counter: Leverage stuns or heavy slows to pin the wraith, forcing it to disgorge the stolen bonuses.
enemies.lore: Their edges blur like chalk dust in motion, only resolving when the battlefield stands perfectly still.

enemies.name: Gradient Sapper
enemies.summary: Vector-chasing saboteurs that accelerate toward downhill buffs while draining everything in their path.
traits: Marked as (∇^{k}); the exponent's red glow tilts in the direction of greatest descent, mirroring the sapper's chosen gradient.

Gain speed according to (v = v_0 +  eta \|
abla B\|), with B representing nearby buff intensity.
enemies.counter: Rotate support zones or erect knockback fields to flatten the gradient before they sprint through your defenses.
enemies.lore: Powder traces roll downhill after them, sketching the invisible slopes they follow.

enemies.name: Weierstrass Prism
enemies.summary: Fractal shifters that jitter between vulnerable and invulnerable states at nowhere-differentiable intervals.
traits: Manifest as (℘^{k}); the exponent flickers chaotically, hinting at the fractal rhythm governing their (10^{k}) shell.
Toggle immunity on a schedule approximating (f(t) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a^n \cos(b^n \pi t)) with (0 < a < 1, b \in \mathbb{N}).
enemies.counter: Sync burst damage to the brief windows when the prism's glow steadies, or lock them down with perfectly timed stasis.
enemies.lore: Each shard refracts whole proofs, scattering fragments of color across the monochrome battlefield.

enemies.name: Planck Shade
enemies.summary: Quantum phantoms that phase in and out of reality, respecting only perfectly timed strikes.
traits: Wink into view as (ħ^{k}); the exponent flashes bright red exactly when they are tangible, revealing the active (10^{k}) reservoir.
Phase according to (\tau = 2\pi / \omega); missed beats reset the cycle and restore a slice of their health tier.
enemies.counter: Coordinate rhythmic towers or metronome buffs to line up hits the instant the shade materializes.
enemies.lore: They shed cold blue motes—quantized echoes of every missed opportunity.

enemies.name: Null Husk
enemies.summary: Empty-set shells that ignore your lanes until provoked, then redistribute their absence as lethal mass.
traits: Appear dormant as (∅^{k}); striking them ignites the exponent, signalling the (10^{k}) payload about to spill outward.
Upon collapse, transfer health (\Delta H = \gamma H_{∅}) evenly to nearby allies unless contained in a void field.
enemies.counter: Ping them with sacrificial shots to control when and where the redistributed mass lands.
enemies.lore: Their translucent powderfall leaves outlines of nothing, framing the foes that absorbed their loss.

enemies.name: Imaginary Strider
enemies.summary: Phase-dancing invaders that stack evasion whenever damage arrives out of phase with their complex stride.
traits: Stride as (ℑ^{k}); each alternating damage type reduces the glowing exponent, collapsing their complex facade.
Gain evasion stacks via (E_{new} = E_{old} + \sigma \sin(\phi_{hit})), rewarding alternating real/imaginary damage inputs.
enemies.counter: Alternate damage schools or use towers that naturally interleave phases to peel away their defenses.
enemies.lore: Indigo grains streak with silver when they fall, sketching complex planes in midair.

enemies.name: Combination Cohort
enemies.summary: Squads bound by binomial ties that reshuffle total health every time a member collapses.
traits: March as ({}^{n}C_{k}^{\,m}); the superscript (m) glows in red to convey the shared (10^{m}) pool sustaining the entire cohort.
Redistribute health per (H_{new} = H_{total} / 	ext{alive}) after each defeat, punishing careless focus fire.
enemies.counter: Spread damage across the squad or deploy simultaneous bursts to overwhelm the redistribution.
enemies.lore: Bronze dust settles in Pascal-triangle dots, counting every combination spent to keep them standing.

maps.title: Lemniscate Hypothesis
maps.path: ∞ loop traced from r² = cos(2θ); mirrored spawn lanes cross twice.
maps.focus: Early E glyphs surge with divisor scouts—tempo control is vital.
maps.example: Goldbach’s Conjecture: Every even integer greater than 2 is the sum of two primes.

maps.title: Collatz Cascade
maps.path: Stepwise descent generated from the 3n + 1 map with teleport risers.
maps.focus: Hit-count enemies appear on odd nodes; summon glyph soldiers to stall.
maps.example: Collatz Conjecture: Iterate n → n/2 or 3n + 1 and every positive integer reaches 1.

maps.title: Riemann Helix
maps.path: Logarithmic spiral with harmonic bulges keyed to ζ(s) zero estimates.
maps.focus: Divisor elites flank wave bosses—Ω previews excel at splash slows.
maps.example: Riemann Hypothesis: Every nontrivial zero of ζ(s) lies on the line Re(s) = 1/2.

maps.title: Twin Prime Fork
maps.path: Dual lattice rails linked by prime gaps; enemies swap lanes unpredictably.
maps.focus: Prime counters demand rapid-fire towers—γ chaining resets their count.
maps.example: Twin Prime Conjecture: Infinitely many primes p exist such that p + 2 is prime.

maps.title: Birch Flow
maps.path: Cardioid river influenced by elliptic curve rank gradients.
maps.focus: Reversal sentinels join late waves—δ soldiers can flip them to your side.
maps.example: Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture: Rational points of elliptic curves link to L-series behavior.

maps.title: Apocrypha Loop
maps.path: Hidden lemniscate mirrored through complex planes; portals bloom off-axis.
maps.focus: Only reveals during total glyph alignment—expect mixed archetypes in waves.
maps.example: Secret Lemma: When harmonic sums stabilize, an unseen proof thread emerges from the void.

maps.title: Derivative Bloom
maps.path: Petal loops bloom where f′(x) = 0 across mirrored cardioids and saddle petals.
maps.focus: Flux bursts alternate with brittle shards—steady α lattices prevent overflow collapses.
maps.example: Rolle's Corollary: If f(a) = f(b) for differentiable f, some c in (a, b) satisfies f′(c) = 0.

maps.title: Integral Cascade
maps.path: Stepped integrator ramps descend in quantized slopes shaped by accumulated area.
maps.focus: Energy leeches drift down ramps—δ summons keep Δ energy above zero.
maps.example: Fundamental Corollary: Integrating a derivative recovers the original function up to constants.

maps.title: Fibonacci Turnabout
maps.path: Interleaved golden spirals shift radius on Fibonacci indices and teleport pads.
maps.focus: Prime counters spawn on Fibonacci junctions—γ conductors reset their tally.
maps.example: Binet Corollary: Fₙ = (φⁿ − ψⁿ)/√5 gives the closed form of Fibonacci growth.

maps.title: Euler Bridge
maps.path: Bridge arcs obey planar graph constraints; parity lanes swap over Euler gaps.
maps.focus: Divisors guard the bridges—β beams must stay coherent to pierce.
maps.example: Euler Characteristic Corollary: For planar graphs, F = E − V + 2 limits feasible crossings.

maps.title: Modular Bloom
maps.path: Modular roses rotate through residue-locked petals with congruence gate warps.
maps.focus: Reversal sentinels invert on residue gates—δ rallies convert them mid-arc.
maps.example: Chinese Remainder Corollary: Congruence systems share synchronized solutions modulo their product.

maps.title: Shadow Integral
maps.path: Phase-shifted archipelago of calculus islands hidden beneath modular petals.
maps.focus: Resource siphons and reversal elites stack together—prepare universal counters.
maps.example: Secret Corollary: The boundary integral of concealed paths equals interior flux you never saw.
